Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Women and Gender Equity.

Items.Title: Oversight - Providing Comprehensive Sex Education as part of Health Education.
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight - Providing Comprehensive Sex Education as part of Health Education.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to student journalism programming at the city’s high schools
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Student journalism programming at the city’s high schools.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.4604, and the New York State Senate to introduce and pass a companion bill, which would require comprehensive sexuality instruction for students in grades K-12 which addresses age and developmentally appropriate physical, mental, emotional and social dimensions of human sexuality and reflects the national sexuality education standards.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Require comprehensive sexuality instruction for students in grades K-12 which addresses age and developmentally appropriate physical, mental, emotional and social dimensions of human sexuality and reflects the national sexuality education standards.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Education Department to allow a lifeguard certification to substitute for Physical Education Credit for high school seniors aged 17 years and older.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Allow a lifeguard certification to substitute for Physical Education Credit for high school seniors aged 17 years and older.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to require age-appropriate human trafficking curriculum and instruction for students in grades K-12.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: DOE to require age-appropriate human trafficking curriculum and instruction for students in grades K-12.

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Cabán, Paladino and Vernikov
